episode_title: 202 - The One With the Breast Milk

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Carol and Susan are showing off Ben to the gang.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, these were unbelievably expensive, and I know he’s gonna grow out of them in like, 20 minutes, but I couldn’t resist. (There a little pair of Nike shoes.)
content.parenthetical: entering from her bedroom carrying a present

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, look at these! Hey, Ben. Just do it. (Ben starts to cry) Oh my God, oh, ok, was that too much pressure for him?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh, is he hungry already?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: I guess so. (Carol starts to breast feed Ben.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, it’s… (sees the feeding taking place next to him) something funny about sneakers. I’ll be right back. (Goes into the kitchen)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I gotta get one, too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you guys doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re just hanging out by the spoons. Ladle?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, would you guys grow up? That is the most natural beautiful thing in the world.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, we know, but there’s a baby suckin’ on it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is my son having lunch, ok? It’s gonna happen a lot, so you’d better get used to it. Now if you have any problem with it, if you’re uncomfortable, just ask questions. Carol’s fine with it, now come on.
(They go back into the living room)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Carol?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Carol? I was just wondering if Joey could ask you a question about breast-feeding?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, does it hurt?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: It did at first, but not anymore.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, uh, how often can you do it?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: As much as he needs.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ok, I got one, I got one. Uh, if he blows into one, does the other one get bigger?

content.description: Central Perk, the gang is all there.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Rachel, do you have any muffins left?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I forget which ones.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Oh, you’re busy, that’s ok, I’ll get it. Anybody else want one?

content.speaker: All
content.text: No thanks.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Oh, you’re losin’ your apron here, let me get it. There you go. (Ties it back up for her)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. (under her breath to Chandler) What a bitch.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Oh, listen you guys. I have this friend at Bloomingdale’s who’s quitting tomorrow and he wants to abuse his discount. So, anyone want to come with me and take advantage of it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t, I have to take my grandmother to the vet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, um, I’ll go with you.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Great.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi, honey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, sweetums.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello to the rest.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monica what’re you doin’? You can’t go shopping with her? What about Rachel?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s gonna be a problem, isn’t it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on, you’re going to Bloomingdale’s with Julie? That’s like cheating on Rachel in her house of worship.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But I’m…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica, she will kill you. She will kill you like a dog in the street.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, uh, Jules tells me you guys are going shopping tomorrow?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, uh, it’s actually not that big a deal.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s a big deal to me. This is great, Monica. I really appreciate this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re welcome.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Woof, woof.

content.description: A Department Store, Joey is selling men’s cologne.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bijan for men? (Another guy walks by) Bijan for men? (Another guy walks by) Bijan for men? (An attractive woman walks by.) Hey Annabelle.

content.speaker: Annabelle
content.text: Hey, Joey. So did you hear about the new guy?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Annabelle
content.text: Nobody knows his name. Me and the girls just call him the Hombre man.
(The Hombre man enters.)

content.speaker: Hombre Man
content.text: Hombre? (The guy says yes, and gets his sample.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s he doin’ in my section?

content.speaker: Annabelle
content.text: I guess he doesn’t know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, he’s gonna. I’ll see you a little later, ok? (To the Hombre Man) Hey, how ya doin’?

content.speaker: Hombre Man
content.text: Mornin’.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, I know you’re new, but it’s kinda understood that everything from Young Men’s to the escalator is my territory.

content.speaker: Hombre Man
content.text: Your territory, huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Bijan for men?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: No thanks.

content.speaker: Hombre Man
content.text: Hombre?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Yeah. All right. (They guy gets his sample and leaves.)

content.speaker: Hombre Man
content.text: You were saying?

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is there as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, listen. You were with me, and we were shopping all day.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We were shopping, and we had lunch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, all right. What did I have?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You had a salad.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, no wonder I don’t feel full.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, guys, what’s up.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I went shopping with Monica all day, and I had a salad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good, Pheebs. What’d you buy?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, we went shopping for um, for, fur.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You went shopping for fur?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, and then I realized I’m against that, and uh, so then we bought some, (sees Monica pointing at her chest) uh, boobs.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You bought boobs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bras! We bought bras! We bought bras.
content.parenthetical: Monica is yanking on her bra strap

content.description: The Department Store, Joey is trying to sell some cologne.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bijan for men? (to a guy) Bijan for men? (To a woman) Bijan for… (Sees it’s a woman and stops.) (To Annabelle who walks up.) Hey, Annabelle, Uh, listen, I was wondering if maybe after work you and I could go maybe grab a cup of coffee.

content.speaker: Annabelle
content.text: Oh, actually I sorta have plans.

content.speaker: Hombre Man
content.text: Ready, Annabelle?

content.speaker: Annabelle
content.text: You bet. (to Joey) Maybe some other time?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, it’s not the first time I lost a girl to a cowboy spraying cologne. (A customer walks by.) Bijan for men? (The customer ignores him, and Joey starts to chase him) Bijan for men?!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Carol is dropping Ben off for Ross to watch.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ok, and this is Funny Clown. Funny Clown is only for after his naps, not before his naps or he won’t sleep.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Carol, we’ve been through this before, ok? We have a good time. We laugh, we play. It’s like we’re father and son.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Honey, relax. Ross is great with him. (Ross looks at her.) Don’t look so surprised. I’m a lovely person.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, this is so cute.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh, I got that for him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My mommies love me. That’s clever.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello? Oh, Hi, Ju—(Sees Rachel is watching)—Hi, Jew! (Walks into the kitchen.) (Listens.) Uh huh? (Listens.) Uh huh? (Listens) Ok. (Listens) Um, sure, that’d be great. See ya then. Bye. (Hangs up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did you just say Hi, Jew?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes. Uh, yes, I did. That was my friend, Eddie Moskowitz. Yeah, he likes it. Reaffirms his faith.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler, Rachel, and Joey are eating, and Phoebe is preparing Ben’s milk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ben, dinner!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks Aunt Pheebs. Hey, you didn’t microwave that, did you, because it’s breast milk, and you’re not supposed to do that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Duh, I think I know how to heat breast milk. Ok. (Squirts some on her wrist and tastes it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What did you just do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I licked my arm, what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s breast milk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, that is juice, squeezed from a person.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What is the big deal? (Tastes the breast milk.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What did you just do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, would people stop drinking the breast milk?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You won’t even taste it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not even if you just pretend that it’s milk?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not even if Carol’s breast had a picture of a missing child on it.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, time lapse. Rachel is entering the living room from her bedroom as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, where is everybody?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: They took Ben to the park. Where’ve you been?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just out. Had some lunch, just me, little quality time with me. Thanks for your jacket.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, no problem. You can borrow it, by the way. (Puts her hand in the pocket) Here are your keys, hon. (She takes the keys out, sets them on the counter, and notices she also grabbed a receipt.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mon, if uh you were at lunch alone, how come it cost you uh 53 dollars?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what probably happened? Someone musta stolen my credit card.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And sorta just put the receipt back in your pocket?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is an excellent excellent question. That is excellent.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, what is with you? Who’d you have lunch with?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Judy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Julie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Jody!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You were with Julie?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, when it started I was just trying to be nice to her because she was my brother’s girlfriend. And then, one thing led to another and, before I knew it, we were…shopping.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Oh my God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, wait. We only did it once. It didn’t mean anything to me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, right. Sure!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really, Rachel, I was thinking of you the whole time. Look, I’m sorry, all right. I never meant for you to find out!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, please, you wanted to get caught. (Waves the receipt)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is not true!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, so you just sort of happened to leave it in here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did it ever occur to you that I might just be that stupid?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, Monica. I just have to know one thing. Did you go with her to Bloomingdale’s ? (Monica looks away.) Oh! Ok, ok, ok, I just really, uh, I just really need to not be with you right now. (Exits.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ben is playing in his crib while Chandler and Ross are leaning against the rim and are completely asleep.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, who’s this? (Listens) Hi, Joanne. Is Rachel working? It’s Monica. (Listens) Yes, I know I did a horrible thing. (Listens) Joanne, it’s not as simple as all that, ok? (Listens) No, I don’t care what Steve thinks. (Listens) Hi, Steve.
(There’s a knock on the door which is answered by Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Carol and Susan
content.text: Hey! (This wakes Chandler and Ross up)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: How did we do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I tasted Ben’s milk, and Ross freaked out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I did not freak out.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Why’d you freak out?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because it’s breast milk. It’s gross.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: My breast milk is gross?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: This should be fun.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, Carol. There’s nothing wrong with it. I just, I just don’t think breast milk is for adults.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Of course the packaging does appeal to grown-ups and kids alike.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ross, you’re being silly. I’ve tried it, it’s no big deal. Just taste it. (Holding out a bottle.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That would be no.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on. It doesn’t taste bad.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, it’s kinda sweet, sorta like, uh…

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Cantaloupe juice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Exactly.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’ve tasted it? You’ve tasted it.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Uh huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you’ve tasted it.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: You can keep saying it, but it won’t stop being true.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gimme the bottle. (Joey hands him the bottle and Ross squirts some on his arm.) Gimme the towel. (Joey gives him the towel and he wipes it off.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is wiping down the peninsula counter as Joey enters dressed like a cowboy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Howdy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Gimme a box a juice. Well, they switched me over to Hombre.
content.parenthetical: sitting on the otherside of the counter from Chandler

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, maybe it’s because of the way you’re dressed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Or maybe it’s because this guy’s doing so good they wanna put more people on it. (Chandler pours some juice in a glass.) You should see this guy, Chandler, he goes through two bottles a day.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What do you care? You’re an actor. This is your day job. This isn’t supposed to mean anything to you.
content.parenthetical: slides the juice across the counter which Joey catches

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know, but, I was the best, you know? I liked being the best. (He downs the glass of juice in one swig.) I don’t know. Maybe I should just get outta the game. They need guys up in housewares to serve cheese.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, say you do that. You know sooner or later somebody’s gonna come along that slices a better cheddar. And then where’re you gonna run?
content.parenthetical: pours more and slides the refill to Joey

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah I guess you’re right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re damn right I’m right. I say you show this guy what you’re made of. I say you stand your ground. I say you show him that you are the baddest hombre west of the lingerie.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m gonna do it. (He downs the juice in one swig again.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right. Now go see Miss Kitty and she’ll fix you up with a nice hooker.

content.description: Outside Central Perk, Rachel is cleaning up and Monica is pleading with her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know what else to say.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well that works out good, because I’m not listening.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I feel terrible, I really do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry, did my back hurt your knife?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, (they go back inside) say that I’m friends with her, we spend some time together. Is that so terrible?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s that terrible?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes. Monica, you don’t get it. It’s bad enough that she’s stolen the guy who might actually be the person that I am supposed to be with, but now, she’s actually (starting to cry), but now she’s actually stealing you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Me? What are you talking about? Nobody could steal me from you. I mean, just because I’m friends with her doesn’t make me any less friends with you. I mean, (starting to cry) you’re my…We’re, we’re…Oh, I love you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I love you too. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys, um I know that this really doesn’t have anything to do with me, but um I love you guys too. (Joins in on the hug.) Oh, I really needed that. (Goes and sits down.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, I know that you’re in a place right now where you really need to hate Julie’s guts, but she didn’t do anything wrong. I mean, she was just a girl who met a guy, and now they go out. I really think that if you gave her a chance, you’d like her. Would you just give that a chance, for me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’d do anything for you, you know that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’d do anything for you. (They hug again.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, wait, wait, wait! (Runs over and joins in on the hug again.)

content.description: The Department Store, Joey and the Hombre man are facing off in Joey’s section.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Mornin’. (The Hombre man ignores him) I said, mornin’.

content.speaker: Hombre Man
content.text: I heard ya.

content.speaker: Store Guy
content.text: All right, everybody, I’m openin’ the doors. You boys ready?

content.speaker: Hombre Man
content.text: Ready.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I’m ready.

(An old West style showdown starts with Joey and the Hombre Man staring each other down as the store guy slowly lets in the first customer while Joey and the Hombre Man get ready to draw. In slow motion they spot the customer, eye each other, draw, and as the customer walks into the middle Joey’s bottle misfires but the Hombre Man spays it into the customer’s eyes.)

content.speaker: Customer
content.text: You idiot, you stupid cowboy, you blinded me, I’m suing!

content.speaker: Store Guy
content.text: Oh my god, Todd! What the hell did you do?

content.speaker: Hombre Man
content.text: I’m sorry. I am such a doofus. I’m so sorry, I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Annabelle
content.text: My god, what happened?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: These new kids, they never last. Sooner or later, they all…stop lastin’. Listen, uh, what do you say I buy you that cup of coffee now?

content.speaker: Annabelle
content.text: Sure.
(They walk off into the sunset, at least a picture of one.)

content.description: Central Perk, Julie and Rachel are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: So.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So. I just thought the two of us should hang out for a bit. I mean, you know, we’ve never really talked. I guess you’d know that, being one of the two of us, though, right?

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: I know, I probably shouldn’t even tell you this, but I’m pretty much totally intimidated by you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? Me?

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Yes. Oh my god, are you kidding? Ross is so crazy about you, and I really wanted you to like me, and, it’s probably me being totally paranoid, but I kinda got the feeling that maybe you don’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you’re not totally paranoid.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Oy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um, ok, uh, oh god, um, when you and uh Ross first started going out, it was really hard for me, um, for many reasons, which I’m not gonna bore you with now, but um, I just, I see how happy he is, you know, and how good you guys are together, and um, Monica’s always saying how nice you are, and god I hate it when she’s right.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Thanks. Hey, listen, would you like to go to a movie sometime or something?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, that’d be great. I’d love it.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: I’d love it too. Shoot, I gotta go. So, I’ll talk to you later.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, Julie.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Bye. (Gets up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye. (After Julie exits.) What a manipulative bitch.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, another showdown is occuring, only this time its between Ross, a plate of cookies, and the breast milk. They’ve been eyeing each other for a while now, and Chandler and Joey are getting bored. He checks his Ross and in frustration, shoves his watch in front of Ross’s eyes as if saying, “Hurry it up already!” Finally, Ross scratches his head, does that again, itches his nose, scratches his head, grabs the bottle, takes a big swig, and piles several cookies into his mouth.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s not bad.
